meanings.sent1: The whacky hat she wore made everyone smile.

meanings.sent3: His whacky dance moves entertained the whole party.

meanings.sent1: The whacky conspiracy theories he believed in were unbelievable.
meanings.sent2: She had a whacky look in her eyes that made others uneasy.

meanings.sent5: The whacky plan to build a rollercoaster in the backyard was quickly dismissed.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force
meanings.sent1: He whacky the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She whacky the door shut in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to whacky the dough to make it smooth.
meanings.sent4: The storm began to whacky the trees outside.
